png

Class PngChunk

  • java.lang.Object
    • png.PngChunk
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    PngChunkITXT, PngChunkTEXT, PngChunkZTXT

    public class PngChunk
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents an individual chunk in a PNG file.

    Each chunk contains raw byte data, a type identifier, and optionally Exif data. This class also supports flag decoding and keyword/value extraction for textual chunks.

    Refer to the PNG Specification for information on chunk layout and bit-flag meanings.

    Since:
    13 August 2025
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Trevor Maggs

    • Constructor Detail

      • PngChunk

        public PngChunk(long length,
                byte[] typeBytes,
                int crc32,
                byte[] data)
        Constructs a new PngChunk, including an optional Exif parser.
        Parameters:
        length - the length of the chunk's data field (excluding type and CRC)
        typeBytes - the raw 4-byte chunk type
        crc32 - the CRC value read from the file
        data - raw chunk data

    • Method Detail

      • extractPropertyBits

        private static boolean[] extractPropertyBits(int value)
        Extracts the 5th-bit flags from each byte of the chunk type name. Used to determine ancillary/private/reserved/safe-to-copy properties. In a nutshell, it examines Bit 5 to determine whether the corresponding bit is upper-case or lower-case. If Bit 5 is 0, it indicates an upper-case letter. If this bit is a one, it is lower-case.
        Parameters:
        value - the integer representation of the 4-byte chunk type
        Returns:
        boolean array of flags, including ancillary, private, reserved and safeToCopy bits

        public long getLength()
        Retrieves the length of data bytes held by this chunk.
        Returns:
        the length

      • getType

        public ChunkType getType()
        Returns the chunk type.
        Returns:

      • getTag

        public TagPngChunk getTag()
        Retrieves the corresponding tag used in PNG metadata processing.
        Returns:
        the TagPngChunk representation of the chunk type

      • getCrc

        public int getCrc()
        Returns a four-byte CRC computed on the preceding bytes in the chunk, excluding the length field.
        Returns:
        a CRC value defined as an integer

      • calculateCrc

        public int calculateCrc()
        Calculates the CRC-32 checksum for this chunk (type code + data).
        Returns:
        The calculated CRC-32 value.

      • getPayloadArray

        public byte[] getPayloadArray()
        Returns a defensive copy of the raw chunk data.
        Returns:
        the raw data as a byte sub-array

      • hasKeywordPair

        public boolean hasKeywordPair(TextKeyword keyword)
        This method should be sub-classed by one of the textual chunks to create useful functionality.
        Parameters:
        keyword - the TextKeyword to search for
        Returns:
        always false by default

      • getKeywordPair

        public java.util.Optional<TextEntry> getKeywordPair()
        This method should be sub-classed by one of the textual chunks to create useful functionality.
        Returns:
        always Optional.empty() by default

      • getKeyword

        public java.lang.String getKeyword()
        Returns the keyword associated with this chunk.

        The base implementation returns an empty string by design. Subclasses that represent specific textual chunks should override this method to return a meaningful keyword.

        Returns:
        an empty string by default

      • getText

        public java.lang.String getText()
        Returns the text associated with this chunk.

        The base implementation returns an empty string by design. Subclasses that represent specific textual chunks should override this method to return the actual text value.

        Returns:
        an empty string by default

      • isAncillary

        public boolean isAncillary()
        Validates the chunk is ancillary.
        Returns:
        true if the chunk is ancillary, otherwise, it is false

      • isPrivate

        public boolean isPrivate()
        Validates the chunk is private.
        Returns:
        true if the chunk is private, otherwise, it is false

      • isReserved

        public boolean isReserved()
        Validates the chunk is reserved.
        Returns:
        true if the chunk is reserved, otherwise, it is false

      • isSafeToCopy

        public boolean isSafeToCopy()
        Validates the chunk is safe to copy.
        Returns:
        true to indicate the chunk is safe to copy
